data.meta_description: Francis II was King of the Two Sicilies from 22 May 1859 to 20 March 1861. He married Duchess Maria Sophia in Bavaria, a younger sister of Empress "Sissi". Their marriage wasn't consummated for many years, as he suffered from phimosis. While in exile in Rome, Maria became pregnant by an officer of the papal guards and gave birth in secret. Maria later confessed to Francis, their relationship improved. He submitted to an operation which allowed him to consummate the marriage.
